contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Tagawa|the surname|Tagawa (surname)}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Tagawa |JapaneseName= 田川市 |MapImage= Tagawa in Fukuoka Prefecture Ja.svg |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]] |District= |Area_km2= 54.52 |PopDate= May 31, 2011 |Population= 51,128 |Density_km2= 937.78 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 33 |LatitudeMinutes= 38 |LatitudeSeconds= 20 |LongtitudeDegrees= 130 |LongtitudeMinutes= 48 |LongtitudeSeconds= 22 |Tree= [[Ginkgo biloba]], [[Osmanthus]] |Flower= [[Azalea]] |Bird= |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= Nobukatsu Itoh (since May 2003) |CityHallPostalCode= 825-8501 |CityHallAddress= Chuo 1-1, Tagawa City, Fukuoka Prefecture (福岡県田川市中央町１の１) |CityHallPhone= 81-(0)947-44-2000 |CityHallLink= }} {{nihongo|'''Tagawa'''|田川市|Tagawa-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Fukuoka prefecture|Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]. As of May 31, 2011, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 51,128, with 24,348 [[household]]s and a [[population density]] of 937.78 people per km². Its total area is 54.52 km². The city was founded on November 3, 1943. Tagawa was historically a coal mining city, and is easily recognizable by its two tall chimneys located near [[Tagawa-Ita Station|Tagawa-Ita]] (田川伊田駅). Currently active industries in Tagawa include limestone and cement production. Tirol (チロル) miniature chocolates are manufactured in Tagawa. The TRIAL Kyushu warehouse is located in Ita-machi, and services TRIAL discount stores in all prefectures in Kyushu. Tagawa is serviced by two main JR stations, Tagawa-Ita (田川伊田) and [[Tagawa-Gotōji Station|Tagawa-Gotōji]] (田川後藤寺). These stations provide transport links to [[Kokura Station|Kokura]], [[Hita Station|Hita]], and [[Shin-Iizuka Station|Shin-Iizuka]] via the [[Hitahikosan Line]] (日田彦山線) and [[Gotōji Line]] (後藤寺線). In addition, the private rail company [[Heisei Chikuho Railway|Heisei Chikuho Railway Line]] (terminal points: [[Yukuhashi Station|Yukuhashi]] and [[Nōgata Station|Nōgata]]) makes major stops at both Tagawa-Ita and Tagawa-Gotōji. ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://www.joho.tagawa.fukuoka.jp/ Tagawa official website] in Japanese * [http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Tagawa,+Japan&spn=0.029869,0.082191&hl=en/ Google Map of Tagawa] {{Fukuoka}} [[Category:Cities in Fukuoka Prefecture]] {{Fukuoka-geo-stub}}
